overview: From 2025-09-04 to 2025-09-05, elizaos/eliza had 3 new PRs (3 merged), 0 new issues, and 5 active contributors.

topPRs.title: feat: Add standalone CLI chat interface with improved UX
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Changes
- Add new standalone CLI chat interface (`standalone-cli-chat.ts`)
- Enhanced interactive chat experience with improved UX
- Version alignment to 1.5.8-alpha.1 across all packages
- Updated TypeScript configuration

## Features Added
- Interactive command-line chat interface using ElizaOS agents
- Similar to AI SDK's streamText but using ElizaOS runtime and plugins
- Support for LOG_LEVEL and OPENAI_API_KEY configuration
- Clean exit commands (quit/exit)
- Proper text wrapping and formatting

## Files Changed
- 19 files modified (primarily version updates and new chat interface)
- 431 insertions, 39 deletions

## Testing
- Standalone chat interface tested with OpenAI integration
- All existing functionality preserved

topPRs.title: fix: Add DOM types to TypeScript configuration
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Problem

The build was failing with TypeScript compilation errors in `packages/core/src/utils/server-health.ts`:

```
src/utils/server-health.ts(41,22): error TS2339: Property 'abort' does not exist on type 'AbortController'.
src/utils/server-health.ts(46,28): error TS2339: Property 'signal' does not exist on type 'AbortController'.
```

## Root Cause

The TypeScript configuration in `tsconfig.json` only included `["ES2021.String"]` in the `lib` array, which doesn't provide DOM API types needed for `AbortController` and `fetch`.

## Solution

Added DOM types to the TypeScript lib configuration:

```json
"lib": ["ES2021.String", "DOM", "DOM.Iterable"]
```

## Testing

- ✅ Build now completes successfully: `bun run build`
- ✅ All packages build without TypeScript errors
- ✅ No breaking changes to existing functionality

## Files Changed

- `tsconfig.json` - Added DOM and DOM.Iterable to lib array

This fix ensures that web APIs like `AbortController`, `fetch`, and other DOM APIs are properly typed in TypeScript compilation.

topPRs.title: refactor: Move standalone files to examples directory
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Problem

The root directory of the project contained two standalone example files ( and ) that were cluttering the root directory structure. These files are example implementations rather than core project files and should be properly organized.

## Solution

- **Moved files**:  and  from root →  directory
- **Cleaned up**: Removed  from  since it's now properly organized 
- **Improved structure**: All example code is now consolidated in the dedicated examples directory

## Changes Made

-  →  (100% file rename)
-  →  (100% file rename) 
- Updated  to remove  entry

## Benefits

✅ **Better Organization**: Examples are now in a dedicated directory  
✅ **Cleaner Root**: Root directory is less cluttered  
✅ **Easier Discovery**: Developers can find all examples in one place  
✅ **Consistent Structure**: Follows common project organization patterns  

## Testing

- [x] Files successfully moved to examples directory
- [x] File contents remain intact and unchanged
- [x] Git history preserved through proper rename detection
- [x] No functional impact on existing code

This is a pure organizational change with no functional modifications to the code.
